Happy Birthday Willie! 

I realize I'm two days late, but it was just "Da Mayor" Willie Brown's 85th birthday. 

To celebrate the man, the myth, the legend, here's Willie gettin' pied in the face. Truly one of San Francisco's great political moments.

text:
He's back!

Roger Marenco, ousted president from Muni's operator union, TWU Local 250-A, is back in contract negotiations with City Hall. 

The upshot? He's going to try to ensure Muni operators make more money, which may impact Muni service. 

http://www.sfexaminer.com/suspension-muni-union-president-brought-back-contract-talks-city-hall/ …
author: FitzTheReporter

text: OK so certain streets would curtail your access but not others?
author: FitzTheReporter

text: To clarify, I'm not arguing, I really am curious for your opinion. It will inform my reporting.
author: FitzTheReporter

text:
I think the proposal is just for streets that run parallel to each other.  

For instance, Fulton runs from the beach up through Stanyan. Geary runs parallel. If Geary still had car access but Fulton was bus, bike and pedestrian only, would your access be curtailed?
author: FitzTheReporter

text:
Yeah that's fair. We try not to push Sammi too much, like dog parks or the such. But we do train her do she doesnt bark at dogs passing on the sidewalk, that was our aim this past year. 

The distance, the proximity at which she barks, has narrowed a lot! I'm pretty proud of her.
author: FitzTheReporter

text:
With good looks like those, could pass for a cousin to my girlfriend and I's pup, Sammi. 

A shame our Sammi isnt so good with other dogs yet.

 Nervous. Reactive. Barky. We are training her not to be, slowly but surely.

A Muni bus.

text:
Q for #SF Twitter: 

@sfmta_muni is studying what streets, if any, would be best for banning cars. Just buses, bikes and walking. 

So besides Market (which is already set to be car-free soon), what SF streets would be best to be car-free? 

Why? 

More: http://www.sfexaminer.com/sf-transit-officials-begin-studying-car-free-streets/?fbclid=IwAR3kNMz5Yr8c-1bbYupluouKyKJY_crOMM9FfImaXXpg2V6bHFwL9DCbrYw …

Transit officials want to make some San Francisco streets car-free.

@sfmta_muni has been directed by its board to study what SF streets could be #SFMuni, bike and pedestrian only ... with no cars in sight.

BREAKING: Following mounting pressure from the community, @sfmta_muni to plan protected bike lane on Howard *to the waterfront*.

Nothing is yet approved. For more details: http://www.sfexaminer.com/sf-starts-planning-protected-bike-lanes-howard-street-waterfront-cyclists-death/ …

text: I did! huffed up to SFO commission, then huffed back to my office on Powell. Grabbed a streetcar back to City Hall and covered the @sfbike action. When there was one speaker left, dashed around city hall and bounded up the stairs to beat protesters to SFMTA so i could get a seat
author: FitzTheReporter

text: I should mention there's a working group convening to talk about it, stemming form AB 2363. Proposed changes may come as early as Jan. 1 2020 with aim to soften that 85th percentile law.

text:
This long-time taxi driver is earning sighs and disappointed headshakes from people who bike at the @sfmta_muni 

"They should bike more carefully," she said. 

Her comment is the last after an hour's worth of comments calling for safe city infrastructure for people who bike.
author: FitzTheReporter

text: Big turnout from @sfbike @walksf and others to call for a safer Howard Street after the recent death of Tess Rothstein, who was struck and killed while riding her bicycle.
